titleStmt.title: Several choice histories of the medecines manner and method used in the cure of the plague. Written by that famous (and in this disease) incomparable physitian, Isbrandus Diemerbroick; a professor of physick. And now translated into English, with his own annotations upon every history. Wherein not onely the choicest antidotes are set down in his cures, but also several things which prove mortal to all that use them
titleStmt.author: Diemerbroeck, Ysbrand van, 1609-1674.

titleStmt.title: Several choice histories of the medecines manner and method used in the cure of the plague. Written by that famous (and in this disease) incomparable physitian, Isbrandus Diemerbroick; a professor of physick. And now translated into English, with his own annotations upon every history. Wherein not onely the choicest antidotes are set down in his cures, but also several things which prove mortal to all that use them
titleStmt.author: Diemerbroeck, Ysbrand van, 1609-1674.

publicationStmt.publisher: [for Matthew Keinton, at the sign of the Fountain in St. Pauls Church-Yard],

notesStmt.note: With final imprimatur leaf, which identifies printer.
Identified on UMI microfilm (Early English books, 1641-1700) reel 1945 as Wing (2nd ed.) D1417.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
